name: Lekki Conservation Centre
description: A nature reserve with the longest canopy walkway in Africa and rich biodiversity.

name: Annang Festival of Arts & Culture (AFAC)
description: AFAC is more than just a festival; itâ€™s a celebration of the rich cultural heritage of the Annang people.

name: Zuma Rock
description: A giant monolith considered the 'Gateway to Abuja', famous for its human-like facial features.

name: Olumo Rock
description: A historic rock used as a fortress during inter-tribal wars, offering panoramic views of Abeokuta.

name: Yankari National Park
description: Nigeria's largest wildlife park, home to elephants, baboons, and warm spring pools.

name: Nike Art Gallery
description: One of the largest art galleries in West Africa showcasing Nigerian art and culture.

name: Idanre Hills
description: Ancient hills with historical significance and breathtaking scenery.

name: Obudu Mountain Resort
description: A highland resort known for its cool climate, cable cars, and lush landscape.

name: Awhum Waterfall and Cave
description: A spiritual and tourist site with a beautiful waterfall cascading over a cave.

name: Tarkwa Bay
description: A sheltered beach accessible by boat, ideal for surfing, swimming, and picnics.
